meanings.definition: Spilths (noun): a type of liquid spill
meanings.sent1: The spilths on the floor were quickly cleaned up.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to cause a spilths when pouring the juice.
meanings.sent3: The spilths from the overturned cup made a funny pattern on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her tears flowed like spilths down her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The spilths of paint on the canvas created a beautiful abstract art piece.

meanings.definition: Spilths (verb): to accidentally pour out liquid
meanings.sent1: I spilthsed the water while trying to fill the glass too quickly.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to spilths the soup when transferring it to the bowl.
meanings.sent3: He always seems to spilths his drink whenever he's in a rush.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall spilthsed down the rocks with great force.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter managed to spilths the entire tray of drinks on the guests.

meanings.definition: Spilths (adjective): describing something that is messy or wet
meanings.sent1: Her spilths hair stuck to her forehead after playing in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The muddy dog left spilths paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent3: The spilths mud on his shoes made a squelching sound with each step.
meanings.sent4: The spilths clothes in the laundry basket smelled musty and damp.
meanings.sent5: The spilths sponge soaked up all the spilled water from the counter.
